summary: John Willard is identified as an alias of Eric Starvo Galt and Harvey Lowmyer, who is suspected of assassinating Martin Luther King, Jr. The documents consist of cables disseminating information about Galt/Lowmyer/Willard to various locations worldwide, seeking assistance in locating him. These cables, dated April 18, 1968, provide details about Galt, including his aliases and physical description, in connection with the King assassination investigation.
significance: John Willard is an alias used by a suspect in the assassination of Martin Luther King, Jr., making him relevant to the investigation surrounding the assassination.
